replies.text:
If you impose criminal liability on judges for making a bad decision the obvious solution for judges is to let nobody go.  If that is the outcome you want, just change the law so judges cannot release people pre-trial and raise taxes in an appropriate amount to pay for the added infrastructure needed to stay compliant with speedy trial requirements.  

If you want to go after judges for egregiously bad decisions just limit their discretion, but you will still have to contend with the speedy trial problem.  We need more prosecutors, public defenders and judges pretty much everywhere.  Imagine if we had enough immigration judges to actually process asylum applications in less than 5 years. You could catch someone, give them a hearing, and send them home.  A lot of problems could be solved with adequate resources.

replies.author: @ArmyEliteGeminia
replies.text:
As someone who knows a schizo personally I'd posit schizophrenia amplifies the risks from any form of belief. People with schizophrenia often form abstract explanations for patterns they see in their lives and, even divorced from liberal brainwashing, can independently decide something racist like "because I've had poor service quality from 3 Indian shopkeeps this week the continent of India must hate me for some reason." This is an anecdote but still something I've seen in schizophrenics and I don't think people realise how differently they think compared to the average person.

At face value it's about race, but based on my own experiences I'd say it's proportionate to consider schizophrenia the most critical factor. That doesn't make this suddenly not about race, but I think schizophrenic racism can be taken a little less seriously, at least politically.

Personally I believe the biggest issue here is the fact that they let someone that unstable out of detainment so often, and I believe that might where race come sin most, because perhaps progressive judges didn't want to be unkind to someone they saw as "disadvantaged."

Thank you, also, for not making this about race.  He should have been locked up or committed a long time ago.  He was insane.  Had a black woman sat in front of him, I can easily imagine him saying "I got that black girl" or "I got that n-"
Sometimes, race is a descriptor.  I would have to learn more before believing he was motivated by race.
Regardless of what drove him- whether race, a delusion, or simply being an nasty person- he needs locked up for good and the legal system needs taken to task and restructured.

author: @danz1182
text:
In no place where judges are elected to fill vacancies on the bench is it a requirement for a judge to be a member of the state's bar or to even have a law degree.  Some states do not require judges to stand for election and some only require "retention" elections (you get to vote on whether judges stay on the bench, but if a judge loses, retires, or otherwise steps down their replacement is appointed).  Some, but not all, states where judges are appointed do require whoever is doing the appointing to pick from members of the state's bar.  

Bottom line, judges have to be lawyers only in a small minority of states.

author: @NightMotorcyclist
text: I worked for NYC Transit as a track maintainer and was attacked on the job by the usual suspects and sand bullies. In response I advocated for self defense tools being allowed on transit. I was promptly ordered into anger management and transit police visited my house over a post on Twitter and threatened arrest. Female doctors, female counselors and even one of the cops was female, all telling me this. In fact the FEMALE counselor at MTA's Work/ Life Services told me that NYC will always be dangerous and if I didnt' feel safe on the job to quit and do something else. The FEMALE doctor at MTA's Medical Assessment Center told me that the police cannot be everywhere and to expect a city like NYC to be violent and unsafe and that being hypervigilant was a sign of mental illness and ordered me suspended until I completed anger management.
